intro: Cyclosorus pennatus, commonly known as the feather moss, is a species of moss that belongs to the family Pottiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, needle-like leaves that are arranged in a feathery pattern, giving it its common name. This plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rock crevices. Cyclosorus pennatus is known for its ability to thrive in low-light conditions and its tolerance for damp, acidic soils. Its small size and intricate structure make it an important component of many ecosystems, contributing to soil stability and providing habitat for microorganisms.
